title: EPFO to invest nearly Rs 5,000 crore in stocks in 2015-16
text: MUMBAI: After years of deliberation, one of India's most cash rich fund the EPFO (Employee Provident Fund Origination) will invest in stock markets through Exchange Traded Fund (ETF). The EPFO will kick starts the process of investing in the stock market on Thursday with an initial corpus of around Rs 5,000 crore through ETFs in the current fiscal. EPFO is sitting on a cash pile of more than Rs 8.5 lakh (over $ 100 billion) crore but the fund will invest only incremental inflows that it gets from the current month, into stock markets. EPFO will invest through SBI's two ETF's one based on BSE's benchmark index Sensex and the other on National Stock Exchange's (NSEs) Nifty index. "Investment of pension funds in stock markets is an internationally accepted practice," Ashish Chauhan, MD and CEO, BSE said. "Many citizens world over have been able to obtain better returns by investing through stock markets. Using ETF as the vehicle by EPFO for such investment has made the entire process transparent. BSE welcomes Investments in stock market through ETF using Sensex ETF. " "EPFO's entry in stock markets will unlock savings into nation building," said Chitra Ramkrishna, MD & CEO, NSE. "It will certainly deepen the financial market in India." The Labour Ministry had notified in April that EPFO would be allowed invest minimum of 5% and up to 15% of its funds in equity or equity related schemes. EPFO, however, has decided to invest 5% of its incremental deposits in ETFs during the current fiscal.
